title: How to Print Pictures from Your Phone

steps.title: Connect a wireless-enabled printer to your Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Connect a wireless-enabled printer to your Wi-Fi network. Your printer needs to be connected to the same Wi-Fi network as your phone in order to print from your phone. The way you connect your printer to Wi-Fi is different from one printer to another. Consult the user's manual or manufacturer's web page for your printer if you need help connecting your printer to Wi-Fi.

steps.title: Connect your phone to your Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Connect your phone to your Wi-Fi network. Make sure your phone is connected to the same Wi-Fi network. If it's not already connected to Wi-Fi, use the following steps to connect your phone to Wi-Fi: Swipe down from the top of your screen. Tap and hold the Wi-Fi icon. Tap the wireless network your printer is connected to. Enter your password if needed. Tap Connect .

steps.title: Open the Settings menu .
steps.content: Open the Settings menu . The Settings menu has an icon that resembles a gear. Tap the icon on your Home screen or apps menu on your Android phone.

steps.title: Tap the magnifying glass icon .
steps.content: Tap the magnifying glass icon . It's in the upper-right corner of the Settings menu. This displays the Search menu. The Settings menu is different from one Android phone model to another. The easiest way to find specific items in the Settings menu is to use the search functionality.

steps.title: Type Printing in the search bar.
steps.content: Type Printing in the search bar. This displays the menu with the Printing options. On most Android phones, this can be found under "Connection Preferences" followed by "Connected Devices". On Samsung Galaxy phones, this can be found under "Connections" followed by "More connection settings".

steps.title: Tap Printing.
steps.content: Tap Printing . This opens the menu with the Printing option.

steps.title: Tap Printing.
steps.content: Tap Printing . This opens the Printing menu.

steps.title: Tap Default Print Service.
steps.content: Tap Default Print Service . This is the default printing plug-in for Android devices. Your phone will start scanning your network for available printers. Alternatively, if you have a Samsung Galaxy phone, you can tap Samsung Print Service Plugin . If you want to use a third-party plug-in, tap Download Plugin at the bottom of the menu to display a list of third-party print service plug-ins from the Google Play Store. As of 2021, Google Cloud Print is no longer available.

steps.title: Tap your printer.
steps.content: Tap your printer. This connects your printer to your phone. You can now print to your printer from your phone.

steps.title: Open the Gallery.
steps.content: Open the Gallery. It has an icon that resembles a stack of photos. Tap the Gallery icon on your Home screen.

steps.title: Tap a photo you want to print.
steps.content: Tap a photo you want to print. Photos are organized by album. Tap an album with a photo you want to print and then tap the photo to display it in full-screen mode.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . It's the icon with three vertical dots in the upper-right corner. This displays a pop-up menu.

steps.title: Tap Print.
steps.content: Tap Print . It's at the bottom of the menu. This prints the photo. [1] X Research source [2] X Research source

steps.title: Connect your printer to your Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Connect your printer to your Wi-Fi network. Your printer must be Wi-Fi enabled and support AirPrint. The process for connecting your printer to Wi-Fi will vary depending on your printer. Generally, you'll use the printer's built-in menu to select your wireless network and enter the password to join. Consult the user's manual or manufacturer's web page for your printer if you need help connecting your printer to a Wi-Fi network. You can see if your printer is AirPrint-compatible by checking Apple's support page .

steps.title: Make sure there is photo paper in your printer.
steps.content: Make sure there is photo paper in your printer. Most modern desktop printers will have a special tray for photo paper that your iPhone will automatically print pictures from. This tray may be adjustable, and the location will vary depending on the printer. Refer to your printer's documentation for instructions on putting photo paper in the tray.

steps.title: Ensure you're connected to the same network as the printer.
steps.content: Ensure you're connected to the same network as the printer. You cannot print to your AirPrint printer remotely from a different Wi-Fi network. Use the following steps to connect your iPhone to a Wi-Fi network: Tap the icon with two gears to open the Settings menu. Tap Wi-Fi . Tap the toggle switch to turn Wi-Fi on if needed. Tap the name of your Wi-Fi network. Enter your wireless network.

steps.title: Open Photos on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open Photos on your iPhone. This app icon looks like a multicolored flower. You can find this app on your home screen or by searching.

steps.title: Tap a photo you want to print.
steps.content: Tap a photo you want to print. If you want to print more than one photo, tap and hold a picture and it will get a blue checkmark in the upper left corner to indicate that it is selected. You can continue tapping to add pictures to your selection. Make sure you don't select a video, though, as that will prevent you from getting the option to print. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the icon that resembles a box with an arrow pointing up .
steps.content: Tap the icon that resembles a box with an arrow pointing up . This is the Share icon. You'll find this in the lower-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Print.
steps.content: Tap Print . You'll find this in the second row of sharing options. It has an icon that resembles a You may have to swipe the row from right to left to see it.

steps.title: Tap "Select Printer."
steps.content: Tap "Select Printer." Your iPhone will scan your wireless network for available printers. A list of available printers will appear.

steps.title: Tap your printer.
steps.content: Tap your printer. If your printer is not on the list, verify that it is connected to the same Wi-Fi network and that it is AirPrint compatible. Restarting the printer and your router will usually fix connection errors. If you need more printing options, you may want to try the printing app from your printer's manufacturer, like the HP app, HP Smart. Check the App Store for third-party print options.

steps.title: Tap Print to print the selected photos.
steps.content: Tap Print to print the selected photos. Your printer will automatically attempt to print from the photo paper tray on your printer.
